content: Singaporean pastry chef **Cheryl Koh** (born c. 1981) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean) [pastry chef](/wiki/Pastry_chef) who works at [French](/wiki/French_cuisine) restaurant [Les Amis](/wiki/Les_Amis_(restaurant)) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). She was named Asia's Best Pastry Chef 2016 by [The World's 50 Best Restaurants](/wiki/The_World%27s_50_Best_Restaurants). ## Education Cheryl Koh attended [St Nicholas Girls' School](/wiki/St_Nicholas_Girls%27_School) and [Catholic Junior College](/wiki/Catholic_Junior_College), and then the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) where she studied Geography and European Studies. ## Career After graduating from university, she started working full time in the kitchen of [Raffles Hotel](/wiki/Raffles_Hotel), having worked there part time as a student. She worked there for a year, and decided to pursue a career in professional kitchens. She then moved to Paris, where she worked in the restaurant [Lasserre](/wiki/Lasserre_(restaurant)). After a further two years, she moved to [Dubai](/wiki/Dubai) and worked at the [Burj Al Arab](/wiki/Burj_Al_Arab) hotel. Then a stint at the [Don Alfonso 1890](/wiki/Don_Alfonso_1890) restaurant in Italy was followed by working at the [Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong](/wiki/Mandarin_Oriental,_Hong_Kong) and the restaurant Cepage. When that restaurant closed, she relocated to [Les Amis](/wiki/Les_Amis_(restaurant)) in Singapore, another restaurant in the same group. Under the same group as the restaurant, she has also opened a dessert only restaurant called Tarte by Cheryl Koh. ## Recognition In 2016, Koh was named Asia's Best Pastry Chef by [The World's 50 Best Restaurants](/wiki/The_World%27s_50_Best_Restaurants).
title: Cheryl Koh
